In the meantime you can take a look at the PropertyManager and
XMLPropertyManager of the JUnit-addons package
<http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net>.  You can specify your arguments in a
property or XML file and access them in your tests.  If you have 10s of
variables, I think its handy to be able to organize them.

-Vladimir
